title: BitKongy
author: BitKongy
content: What happened to intel ARC graphic cards? Are they dead on arrival or what? I am asking because no crypto miner seem to use these graphic cards for mining a mining rig, not even a video of a complete rig been built using intel graphic card.

comments.author: loveselenagomez
comments.body: Intel Falling Since AMD Coming in market. I don't think intel Arc Gpu is Powerful for mining if launch,their gpu launch not gonna happen ðŸ˜­ðŸ˜­

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: BitKongy on August 07, 2022, 05:44:16 AMWhat happened to intel ARC graphic cards? Are they dead on arrival or what? I am asking because no crypto miner seem to use these graphic cards for mining a mining rig, not even a video of a complete rig been built using intel graphic card. That is because they have postponed the actual date.Even when they come out for sale the miners need some time to test them,only when successful tests will be shown on official channels like Telegram,Youtube and others from people who keep making content about mining only then you can see a user to build a complete mining rig with Intel cards,you cannot see it before such happenings or if a user is bold enough to go and build this without seeing quite some reviews first he most likely will be in troubleshooting mode rather than in mining mode.So most likely these cards will come out in Fall 2022 which is the next three upcoming months.

comments.author: Widdop37
comments.body: I've only seen Intel gpu in gaming action not mining and I heard the launch is postponed but really as a miner, there is no reason to wait for intel gpu when others are performing so well, I am satisfied with everything that Nvidia and AMD are throwing at my face.

comments.author: JayDDee
comments.body: Reports of its death are premature. Intel is in it for the long run targetting gamers not miners, and starting small.Sure they've had problems but they also had problems with CPUs for the last 5 years. AVX512 and 10nm node are 5 yearslate on the desktop.I expect mining interest to be slow to pick up for many reasons. First Intel doesn't care so miner devs don't get advanced samplesto play with. Second they aren't building big GPUs yet, which are preferred for mining. And third it will take time for the miner devs tomake the necessary SW modifications for functionality, then tuning and optimization. When decent mining GPUs become available there couldbe competition among miners devs to be first and fastest, and of course snag the highest dev fees. Hopefully there will be an open source miner.

comments.author: Outhue
comments.body: Intel should just keep focusing in their CPU, I mean they are good at that more than GPU and also it will be very hard to catch up with amd and nvidia, I knew this will ne a challenging step since they release the intel arc GPUs, nothing can beat nvidia and amd in this gpu field anymore.
